programme.title: Bloomberg The Asia Trade
programme.desc: Live from Tokyo and Sydney with Shery Ahn and Haidi Stroud-Watts, getting insight and analysis from newsmakers and industry leaders on the biggest stories shaping markets.

programme.title: Bloomberg The Asia Trade
programme.desc: Live from Tokyo and Sydney with Shery Ahn and Haidi Stroud-Watts, getting insight and analysis from newsmakers and industry leaders on the biggest stories shaping markets.

programme.title: Bloomberg: The China Show
programme.desc: Your definitive source for news and analysis on the world's second-biggest economy. Hosted by Yvonne Man and David Ingles.

programme.title: Insight With Haslinda Amin
programme.desc: The definitive guide for global news audiences to get the complete picture on the biggest story of the day, through probing interviews and nuanced conversations.

programme.title: Bloomberg Horizons Middle East & Africa
programme.desc: Linking the market drivers from overnight in the US and across Asia into the region's trading day, with deep dive analysis of the top business, energy and geopolitical stories shaping decisions.

programme.title: Bloomberg Daybreak: Europe
programme.desc: Live from London, we catch you up with overnight markets news from the US and Asia. Plus, we'll tell you what matters for investors in Europe, giving you insight before trading begins.

programme.title: Bloomberg: The Opening Trade
programme.desc: Everything you need to know as markets open across Europe. We break down today's biggest stories and speak to guests with skin in the game. Hosted by Anna Edwards, Guy Johnson and Kriti Gupta.

programme.title: The Pulse With Francine Lacqua
programme.desc: Conversations with high profile guests in the beating heart of global business, finance and politics. We go wherever the story is, bringing you exclusive interviews and market-moving scoops.

programme.title: Bloomberg Brief
programme.desc: Delivering the market news, data and analysis you need to set your agenda.

programme.title: Bloomberg Surveillance
programme.desc: Daily conversations with leaders and decision makers from Wall Street to Washington and beyond. Hosted by Jonathan Ferro, Lisa Abramowicz and Annmarie Hordern.

programme.title: Bloomberg Open Interest
programme.desc: Matt Miller, Katie Greifeld and Sonali Basak deliver the market-moving news you need to know to get a jump start on the US trading day.

programme.title: Bloomberg Technology
programme.desc: The only daily news programme focused exclusively on technology, innovation and the future of business. Hosted by Ed Ludlow from San Francisco and Caroline Hyde in New York.

programme.title: Bloomberg ETF IQ
programme.desc: Bloomberg ETF IQ focuses on the opportunities, risks and trends tied to the trillions of dollars in the global exchange traded funds industry. Hosted by Matt Miller, Katie Greifeld and Eric Balchunas.

programme.title: Bloomberg Markets
programme.desc: Bloomberg Markets is focused on bringing you the most important global business and breaking markets news and information as it happens.

programme.title: Bloomberg: Balance Of Power
programme.desc: Bloomberg: Balance of Power focuses on the politics and policies being shaped by the agenda of President Biden's administration.

programme.title: Bloomberg Businessweek
programme.desc: Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec bring together the latest news from the world of business and finance by harnessing the power of Bloomberg Businessweek reporters and editors.

programme.title: Bloomberg The Close
programme.desc: Alix Steel, Romaine Bostick and Scarlet Fu own the market-moving breaking news around the closing bell in this must-watch daily program to get an edge on equities, earnings and the economy.

programme.title: Natural Treasures

programme.title: Natural Treasures

programme.title: 10 Animals That Will Kill You
programme.desc: From dingoes to cows, there are a lot of ways to die out there. programme.title: Land Of The Iberian Lynx

programme.title: Trials Of The Wild
programme.desc: On the edge of the Sahara Desert in Mali, a society struggles to thrive. This isn't a society of humans but of rare desert elephants. More than just a herd of animals, they are a tribe of extended families and comrades with their own unique culture.

programme.title: The Incredible Pol Farm
programme.desc: The Pol‚Äôs new livestock aren‚Äôt potty trained; their sheep hut isn‚Äôt draining properly and has now been transformed into a Pee Palace. It‚Äôs late fall and the winter deep freeze is just around the corner, so the family needs to get it fixed fast. The Pol‚Äôs also get a new sheep for their farm.

programme.title: Heartland Docs, DVM
programme.desc: Early spring in Nebraska brings new life and unpredictable veterinary challenges for Drs. Erin and Ben Schroeder as they treat a cow‚Äôs prolapsed uterus, diagnose a deadly intestinal disease and perform a canine C-section with sons Charlie and Chase assisting. The vets also tend to an injured wild owl, a sheep too weak to stand and a litter of cats with ear mites.

programme.title: Eternal Enemies: Lions And Hyenas
programme.desc: National Geographic goes to Botswana to examine the struggle for survival between lions and hyenas.

programme.title: Eternal Enemies: Lions And Hyenas
programme.desc: National Geographic goes to Botswana to examine the struggle for survival between lions and hyenas.

programme.title: Predator V Prey
programme.desc: A forensic look at how lions hunt large prey like buffalo and zebra, offering new perspectives on the way these predators stalk, chase and kill. A lone lioness relies on cunning to feed her newborn cubs, whilst a fearless pride tries to take down the biggest prey of all, a giant African elephant. .

programme.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol
programme.desc: The Pol‚Äôs welcome a new foal to the family as the warmer spring temperatures turn up the heat on animal emergencies. Dr. Brenda‚Äôs knee snaps while saving the life of a mare. Dr. Pol is called out to treat five calves that are struggling to grow. Dr. Nicole plucks quills from a curious Chihuahua, and Dr. Lisa treats a cat with a blocked bladder.

programme.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol
programme.desc: Merlin the macaw lands at the clinic for a beak trim and ruffles a few feathers. Dr. Pol responds to an emergency call for an ailing alpaca, and Dr. Lisa pulls porcupine quills from a feisty cow. Dr. Brenda performs an emergency C-section on a Pit bull, as Dr. Nicole is called out to aid a stalled farrowing. Charles hopes that he has a solution for seat-stealing Tater.

programme.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol
programme.desc: Dr. Pol & Diane welcome a new Friesian filly to the family. Dr. Lisa handles two Corgi emergencies, and Dr. Olivia gets help treating two dogs with curious wounds. Doc treats a mini horse with excessive thirst and a chicken with a paralyzed crop. An emotional support rabbit needs a checkup before heading off to college, and clinic staffer, Hilary, brings in one of her own dogs for veterinary care. .

programme.title: Queens
programme.desc: The African Savanna is home to the ultimate animal sisterhood; a family of elephants. A new baby will need the family‚Äôs support to make it through her early vulnerable months. While mom learns how to care for her, it is the baby‚Äôs grandmother, the matriarch, that must protect her. Facing predators, drought and a rapidly changing world can this new baby and her family of iconic females survive?.

programme.title: Queens
programme.desc: In the heart of Tanzania, the towering walls of the Ngorongoro crater sets a stage for one of the most infamous rivalries in the natural world. The sisters of a formidable lion pride clash with a hyena clan ruled by an all-powerful queen. The sisterhood share responsibility, while the hyena queen must play clan politics and enforce a strict hierarchy to keep her crown.

programme.title: Queens
programme.desc: Under the rainforest canopy of Central America is a secret world ruled by insects. Two tiny queens will give everything to build their empires. The ant queen will sacrifice her own body for the future of her growing colony while the beautiful orchid bee will stop at nothing for success; betraying those closest to her.

programme.title: Queens
programme.desc: The Congo Forest in Central Africa is home to a secretive animal we still know very little about. Bonobos are one of our closest relatives, but in their society it‚Äôs females who rule. A young bonobo must leave behind her family, to find her place in the world. Here, friendship is the key to survival. She must make new friends and impress the alpha female before she can truly fit in.

programme.title: Queens
programme.desc: The coastal realm of land and sea is home to two of nature‚Äôs most iconic females ‚Äì orca and grizzly bears. Under the waves in the Gulf of California, the orca family‚Äôs success relies on the experience of their sixty-year-old matriarch; while on the beaches of Alaska, a first-time bear mother must raise her three cubs alone and with only her instincts to guide her.

programme.title: Land Of The Iberian Lynx
programme.desc: Spring rains bring new opportunities and hope to the land of the Iberian lynx. But for the female lynxes of the valley, it is always a challenge to raise their cubs. The series follows the lynxes in their struggle for survival, from the thrill of the hunt to the tender moments of parenting, and also witnesses their coexistence with other animals like majestic golden eagles or powerful deer.

programme.title: Europe's Wild Places Mashup
programme.desc: Europe is covered in deep snow, forcing endless hardships on its winter wildlife. Lynx and mountain savvy chamois are built to withstand storms and avalanches. Lemming populations boom beneath the snow, and arctic foxes know just where to find snacks. Yet, predators like wolverines, bears, and wolves fight over scraps. Only the most resourceful can thrive in this unforgiving frozen world.

programme.desc: A wealth of wildlife, including some of the worlds most remarkable wild survivors, make their homes in the Mediterraneans serene waters, along its vast coastlines and on its remote islands. programme.title: Equator's Wild Secrets

programme.desc: Spring has sprung, but a snowstorm hits Nebraska, forcing the Drs. Erin and Ben Schroeder to contend with unpredictable weather. Despite the snow, springtime for the docs means helping to bring new life into the world, whether its doing a pregnancy check on a herd of 200 cattle; artificially inseminating a German shorthair dog; or wrangling a potentially pregnant pot-bellied pig.

programme.title: Equator's Wild Secrets
programme.desc: Seven hundred miles off the coast of Ecuador lies a collection of volcanic islands that harbor some of the strangest living things to ever exist. These are the Galapagos Islands.Emerging from beneath the ocean more than 20 million years ago, life here has evolved in isolation to give rise to an astonishing variety of creatures, many found nowhere else on the planet. .

programme.title: 10 Animals That Will Kill You
programme.desc: From dingoes to cows, there are a lot of ways to die out there. The odds of being killed by an animal may be slim but just in case‚Ä¶here are ten ways you might die and perhaps how to avoid it. Yukon vet, Michelle Oakley and wildlife filmmaker, Filipe DeAndrade draw on their own knowledge and personal anecdotes to teach us a thing or two about critters that will kill you. But do those animals want to‚Ä¶ really?.
